content:
Investments Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 29 May 2019Anyone know the dividend tax & capital gains tax for a Singapore investor for europe, more specially UK, Germany & France?

Many thanks!Been looking to investing to foreign stocks. Understand that HK have nil withholding taxes for both dividend & capital gains, while US is 30% for dividend, nil tax for capital gains, Swiss is 15% for dividend, nil tax for capital gains.1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 29 May 2019If you are investing through a broker, I believe its best to check with them. They will be able to better advice you. :)0 comments1
